verse.devanagari: नागेन्द्रहाराय त्रिलोचनाय भस्माङ्गरागाय महेश्वराय। नित्याय शुद्धाय दिगम्बराय तस्मै नकाराय नमः शिवाय॥
verse.transliteration: nāgendrahārāya trilocanāya bhasmāṅgarāgāya maheśvarāya | nityāya śuddhāya digambarāya tasmai nakārāya namaḥ śivāya ||
verse.meaning: Salutations to Shiva, who wears the king of serpents as a garland, who has three eyes, whose body is smeared with sacred ash, who is eternal, pure, and the great lord.

verse.devanagari:
ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च |
शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ||१४-२७||
verse.transliteration:
brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāhamamṛtasyāvyayasya ca .
śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya ca ||14-27||
verse.meaning: 14.27 For I am the abode of Brahman, the immortal and the immutable, of everlasting Dharma and of absolute bliss.

verse.devanagari:
गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा |
पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः ||१५-१३||
verse.transliteration:
gāmāviśya ca bhūtāni dhārayāmyahamojasā .
puṣṇāmi cauṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ somo bhūtvā rasātmakaḥ ||15-13||
verse.meaning: 15.13 Permeating the earth I support all beings by (My) energy; and having become the watery moon I nourish all herbs.

verse.devanagari:
सञ्जय उवाच |
इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः |
संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् ||१८-७४||
verse.transliteration:
sañjaya uvāca .
ityahaṃ vāsudevasya pārthasya ca mahātmanaḥ .
saṃvādamimamaśrauṣamadbhutaṃ romaharṣaṇam ||18-74||
verse.meaning: 18.74 Sanjaya said  Thus I have heard this wonderful dialogue between Krishna and the high-souled Arjuna, which causes the hair to stand on end.

verse.devanagari:
एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः |
आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||१६-२२||
verse.transliteration:
etairvimuktaḥ kaunteya tamodvāraistribhirnaraḥ .
ācaratyātmanaḥ śreyastato yāti parāṃ gatim ||16-22||
verse.meaning: 16.22 A man who is liberated from these three gates to darkness, O Arjuna, practises what is good for him and thus goes to the Supreme Goal.

verse.devanagari:
ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च |
शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ||१४-२७||
verse.transliteration:
brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāhamamṛtasyāvyayasya ca .
śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya ca ||14-27||
verse.meaning: 14.27 For I am the abode of Brahman, the immortal and the immutable, of everlasting Dharma and of absolute bliss.

verse.devanagari:
एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः |
आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||१६-२२||
verse.transliteration:
etairvimuktaḥ kaunteya tamodvāraistribhirnaraḥ .
ācaratyātmanaḥ śreyastato yāti parāṃ gatim ||16-22||
verse.meaning: 16.22 A man who is liberated from these three gates to darkness, O Arjuna, practises what is good for him and thus goes to the Supreme Goal.

verse_of_week.devanagari:
धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् |
तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ||८-२५||
verse_of_week.transliteration:
dhūmo rātristathā kṛṣṇaḥ ṣaṇmāsā dakṣiṇāyanam .
tatra cāndramasaṃ jyotiryogī prāpya nivartate ||8-25||
verse_of_week.meaning: 8.25 Attaining to the lunar light by smoke, night time, the dark fortnight also, the six months of the southern path of the sun (the southern solstice), the Yogi returns.

lifestyle_recommendations: Chaturthi energy: clear one pending task and remove one source of clutter.
Somavara: start the week with a short sankalpa and 10 minutes of silence.
Guruvara: reserve time for study, guidance, or one act of teaching.
Daily anchor: avoid digital overload for one focused hour after sunrise.
